gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Gulf of Mexico Research Initiative Information and Data Cooperative

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Harte Research Institute for Gulf of Mexico Studies, Texas A and M University - Corpus Christi, 6300 Ocean Drive

gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic Information - Metadata - Part 2: Extensions for Imagery and Gridded Data

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Coastal wetland vegetation assessment data collected to characterize marsh vegetative communities throughout coastal Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama from Fall 2010 to Fall 2013

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This report contains coastal wetland vegetation assessment data, and provides additional context for the posted dataset, including information about the collection, analysis, and organization of the data. Characteristics of this dataset include the following: The coastal wetland vegetation assessment data characterize the marsh vegetative community at multiple points in space and time. This dataset consists of data collected cooperatively with the Trustees. Before posting, extensive work was done independently by BP contractors to verify some aspects of the posted data (e.g., positional coordinates and field data). The focus of this data posting is coastal wetland vegetation assessment data collected to characterize marsh vegetative communities at 202 sites throughout coastal Louisiana (164 sites including 14 sites established in Barataria Bay), Mississippi (22 sites), and Alabama (16 sites). Data collection was initially conducted in Fall 2010 at 150 of the 164 sites in Louisiana and in Spring 2011 at all of the previously established 150 Louisiana sites, the 14 remaining sites in Louisiana (Barataria Bay) as well as all of the sites in Alabama and Mississippi. During fall 2011, fall 2012, and fall 2013, monitoring was repeated at all 202 sites. The data were collected under the work plan titled Sampling and Monitoring Plan for the Assessment of MC252 Oil Impacts to Coastal Wetland Vegetation in the Gulf of Mexico, including three addenda. The work plan was cooperatively developed and implemented as part of the NRDA for the DWH Horizon accident. This dataset includes data associated with field observations: Visual estimates and counts of vegetative conditions Instrument-based measurements of environmental conditions (e.g., reduction-oxidation potential [REDOX], light-adapted fluorescence [LAF], and chlorophyll content [CC]) Vegetation and sediment sampling (biomass and nutrient data1) Soil condition data Sampling variations may exist across observers, methods, locations, and times. For example, erosion and site flooding occasionally limited or completely inhibited sampling so only a portion of or no data could be collected.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The purpose of the data were to assess impacts to Coastal Wetland Vegetation in the Gulf of Mexico as part of a Natural Resource Damage Assessment (NRDA). These data were collected by BP to help guide cleanup operations under the direction of the U.S. Coast Guard and to support the Natural Resource Damage Assessment efforts by federal and state agencies and BP to evaluate potential injury to natural resources in the Gulf. The data and supplemental information are being made available to the public in a format that will facilitate the use of the data for research and other studies. GRIIDC is making these data available following the shutdown of the Gulf Science Data Portal. This will ensure that the data are available and searchable through GRIIDC data discovery.

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: >10% Beyond 30m (Y/N) Oil Penetration Distance = Whether or not more than 10% of oil was observed over 30 meters inland from marsh edge (Yes/No, NA = Not Applicable, ND = No Data); Aboveground Biomass Dry Weight Density kg/m = Aboveground biomass dry weight density in kilograms per square meter; Additional Info = Additional notes recorded; AEL DryWeight g = Dry weight reported by Advanced Environmental Laboratories in grams; AEL ID = Sample identification code assigned to the sample by Advanced Environmental Laboratories; Agalinis maritima_DEAD = Percent cover of dead Agalinis maritima (%); Agalinis maritima_LIVE = Percent cover of live Agalinis maritima (%); Alternanthera philoxeroides_DEAD = Percent cover of dead Alternanthera philoxeroides (%); Alternanthera philoxeroides_LIVE = Percent cover of live Alternanthera philoxeroides (%); Analyte Name = Name of analyte (Sulfate as SO4; Ammonia as N; Bulk Density; Nitrate/Nitrite as N; Organic Matter; pH; Salinity; Total Phophorus) Analyte Type = Type of analyte (SPK or TRG); Analytical Method = Method used to analyze the sample by Advanced Environmental Laboratories; Arrival Date = Data sample arrived at laboratory (MM/D/YYYY); Aster sp_DEAD = Percent cover of dead Aster sp. observed (%); Aster sp_LIVE = Percent cover of live Aster sp. observed (%); Avicennia germinans_DEAD = Percent cover of dead Avicennia germinans observed (%); Avicennia germinans_LIVE = Percent cover of live Avicennia germinans observed (%); Avicennia pneumatophores_DEAD = Number of dead Avicennia pneumatophores (%); Avicennia pneumatophores_LIVE = Number of live Avicennia pneumatophores (%); Baccharis halimifolia_DEAD = Percent cover of dead Baccharis halimifolia (%); Baccharis halimifolia_LIVE = Percent cover of live Baccharis halimifolia (%); Baccharis sp_DEAD = Percent cover of dead Baccharis sp. Total CalcDryWeight g = Total calculated dry weight in grams; Total Dead Aboveground Biomass Density (kg/m) = Total dead aboveground biomass density in kilograms per square meter; Total Dead Vegetation = Total dead vegetation cover in plot (%); Total Live Aboveground Biomass Density (kg/m) = Total live aboveground biomass density in kilograms per square meter; Total Live Vegetation (%) = Total live vegetation cover in plot (%); Total or Dissolved = Fraction of metals extract analyzed; Total Vegetation = Total vegetation cover in plot (%); Transect Length (m) = The length of the transect that was established at the site in meters; Tree Tag No. = Tag identification code on adult mangrove trees tagged in plot; Units = Units of results (percentage by weight, grams per cubic centimeter, milligram per liter, pH units, salinity units, micrograms per liter); Validated by = Name of the organization that performed the data validation; Validation Qualifier = Validation qualifier (J = Estimated, R = Rejected/Unusable); Validation Reason Code = Validation reason code (9 = Precision [all replicates], 14 = Other [defined in validation report]. Note that a designation of a with the reason code number is further defined by the validating organization in the validation reports.); VCI = Measurement of Vegetation Condition Index (degree of chlorosis) (0 = comparable to reference, 0.5 = intensely speckled with yellow, 1.0 = green with considerable yellowing (50%), 2.0 = alive but >50% yellowing of leaves/stems, 3.0 = vegetation dead) (NA = Not Applicable, ND = No Data); VCI Adult = Measurement of Vegetation Condition Index (degree of chlorosis) on adult mangroves 50 centimeters tall (0 = comparable to reference, 0.5 = intensely speckled with yellow, 1.0 = green with considerable yellowing (50%), 2.0 = alive but >50% yellowing of leaves/stems, 3.0 = vegetation dead) (NA = Not Applicable, ND = No Data); VCI CODOMSP = Measurement of Vegetation Condition Index (degree of chlorosis) on codominant species (0 = comparable to reference, 0.5 = intensely speckled with yellow, 1.0 = green with considerable yellowing (50%), 2.0 = alive but >50% yellowing of leaves/stems, 3.0 = vegetation dead) (NA = Not Applicable, ND = No Data); VCI Seedling = Measurement of Vegetation Condition Index (degree of chlorosis) on mangrove seedlings <50 centimeters tall (0 = comparable to reference, 0.5 = intensely speckled with yellow, 1.0 = green with considerable yellowing (50%), 2.0 = alive but >50% yellowing of leaves/stems, 3.0 = vegetation dead) (NA = Not Applicable, ND = No Data); Vegetation Stature = Observation of whether vegetation in plot is standing (ST) or laid over (LO); Vigna luteola_DEAD = Percent cover of dead Vigna luteola (%); Vigna luteola_LIVE = Percent cover of live Vigna luteola (%); Vitality = Was sample dead or alive when received at the laboratory?; VOEI = Measurement of Vegetation Oiling Extent Index (0 = no oil in plot, 0.5 = intermittent oil on stems, 1.0 = oil present on 5-25% of stems, 2.0 = oil on >25-50% of stems, 3.0 = oil present on >50% of stems (NA = Not Applicable, ND = No Data); VOEI 2010 Culms = Measurement of Vegetation Oiling Extent Index on 2010 Vegetation (culms)(0 = no oil in plot, 0.5 = intermittent oil on stems, 1.0 = oil present on 5-25% of stems, 2.0 = oil on >25-50% of stems, 3.0 = oil present on >50% of stems (NA = Not Applicable, ND = No Data); VOEI Adult = Measurement of Vegetation Oiling Extent Index on adult mangroves (0 = no oil in plot, 0.5 = intermittent oil on stems, 1.0 = oil present on 5-25% of stems, 2.0 = oil on >25-50% of stems, 3.0 = oil present on >50% of stems (NA = Not Applicable, ND = No Data); VOEI Seedling = Measurement of Vegetation Oiling Extend Index (VOEI) on mangrove seedlings (<50 centimeters) (0 = no oil in plot, 0.5 = intermittent oil on stems, 1.0 = oil present on 5-25% of stems, 2.0 = oil on >25-50% of stems, 3.0 = oil present on >50% of stems (NA = Not Applicable, ND = No Data); WAR Aliquot Wet Weight g = Aliquot wet weight reported by Water and Air Research laboratory in grams; WAR ID = Sample identification code assigned to the sample by Water and Air Research laboratory; WAR Subsample ID = Subsample identification code assigned to the sample by Water and Air Research laboratory; WAR Total Wet Weight g = Total wet weight reported by Water and Air Research laboratory in grams; Water on Marsh = Observation of presence or absence of water at the plot. (Y = yes, N = no); Wrack = Amount of wrack cover in plot (%); |Sulfate, EPA 300.0, SOP-054-Rev-06, IC; Total Phosphorus, Total EPA 365.3, SOP-059-Rev-01, Spectrophotometer; Ammonia, Total (as N) EPA 350.1, , SOP WC-019-Rev-05, Flow Analyzer; Soil Organic Matter, MC252 Coastal Wetland Plan; Salinity, SM2520B, SOP WC-066-Rev-00, Salinity Meter; pH EPA 9040/SM4500H+B, SOP-002-Rev-08, pH Meter; Bulk Density, ASTM D2937-10; Nitrate-Nitrite, Total EPA 353.2/SM4500 NO3-F, SOP-WC-012-Rev-10, Autoanalyzer; ||||

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Gulf of Mexico Research Initiative Information and Data Cooperative (GRIIDC)
